sentence.text: histone H2A monoubiquitination staining was weakly positive in <5% of tumor cells in 4 of 66 (6%) low-grade endometrial stromal sarcomas and 1 of 18 (6%) endometrial stromal nodules and weakly to moderately positive in <5-40% of tumor cells in 6 of 31 (19%) leiomyosarcomas.

Strong diffuse nuclear histone H2A monoubiquitination staining (defined as >95% of tumor cells) was seen in the round cell component of all 20 (100%) classic MAPK cascade-NUTM2 high-grade endometrial stromal sarcomas and the 3 unusual high-grade endometrial stromal sarcomas which prompted FISH studies confirming YWHAE rearrangement in 2 tumors.
histone H2A monoubiquitination immunoexpression was studied in these tumors and their morphologic mimics to assess its diagnostic utility.

histone H2A monoubiquitination immunohistochemical staining is a highly sensitive marker for YWHAE-NUTM2 high-grade endometrial stromal sarcoma with both classic and unusual morphology and identifies a subset of high-grade endometrial stromal sarcoma with BCOR alterations, including BCOR rearrangement and internal tandem duplication
Morphologic features of MAPK cascade-NUTM2 high-grade endometrial stromal sarcoma may overlap with other uterine sarcoma types.
